docs.abstract: Serving fear on a global scale, this month’s picks include a French werewolf, an Indonesian possessor and a German man eater.
docs.snippet: Serving fear on a global scale, this month’s picks include a French werewolf, an Indonesian possessor and a German man eater.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rent or buy it on most major platforms.

headline.main: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now

docs.abstract: What to cook when you return from the road: a spread of spiced lamb skewers with lemony onions and yogurt, sweet-and-savory pastel de choclo, plate-sized pancakes.
docs.snippet: What to cook when you return from the road: a spread of spiced lamb skewers with lemony onions and yogurt, sweet-and-savory pastel de choclo, plate-sized pancakes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good morning. I’ve been on the road this week, eating in hotels and airport lounges, dreaming of live fires and barbecue pits, imagining myself cooking clams, baking bread, filleting tuna. All I want to do this weekend is cook: spiced lamb skewers with lemony onions (above); grilled asparagus with caper salsa; a sweet and spicy fruit salad for dessert.

docs.abstract: Jonathon Heyward, the incoming, barrier-breaking music director of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, leads the New York Philharmonic this week.
docs.snippet: Jonathon Heyward, the incoming, barrier-breaking music director of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, leads the New York Philharmonic this week.
docs.lead_paragraph: On paper, this week’s New York Philharmonic program had plenty going for it: balance, an up-and-coming conductor, an established soloist. But at David Geffen Hall on Thursday, the concert was only sometimes on the verge of grand, and just as often one or two kindling sticks short of a true fire.

headline.main: Review: A Rising Star Debuts With the Philharmonic

docs.abstract: Gov. Kathy Hochul announced a state budget deal on Thursday with the first statewide ban on the use of natural gas in new buildings.
docs.snippet: Gov. Kathy Hochul announced a state budget deal on Thursday with the first statewide ban on the use of natural gas in new buildings.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York may soon become the first state in the nation to ban natural gas in new construction under a budget deal announced by Gov. Kathy Hochul.

headline.main: New York Poised to Be First State to Ban Gas Stoves in New Buildings

docs.abstract: Can’t find time to exercise on weekdays? Here are five ways to get more out of a Saturday and Sunday routine.
docs.snippet: Can’t find time to exercise on weekdays? Here are five ways to get more out of a Saturday and Sunday routine.
docs.lead_paragraph: Conventional wisdom says that you need at least 30 minutes of exercise five days a week to stay healthy. For many, that means every weekday. But studies over the past few years suggest that working out just on the weekend can offer comparable health benefits, if you block off enough time and the exercise is intense enough.

docs.abstract: Harrison Ball is retiring. After battling addiction, he is engaged to Zac Posen, serious about acting and grateful for his career.
docs.snippet: Harrison Ball is retiring. After battling addiction, he is engaged to Zac Posen, serious about acting and grateful for his career.
docs.lead_paragraph: Harrison Ball, a principal at New York City Ballet, has tears in his toes. His sesamoid bone is crushed and, he said, dying. There is bone shard sticking into a tendon in his foot. His arthritis is so bad that his doctor told him it was comparable to that of an elderly person. He can’t do his job if he can’t pirouette.

headline.main: The Wild Life and Times of a Soon-to-Be Former City Ballet Dancer

docs.abstract: The Tottenham star has given everything for the club he has supported since childhood. As he nears the end of his contract, he owes it nothing.
docs.snippet: The Tottenham star has given everything for the club he has supported since childhood. As he nears the end of his contract, he owes it nothing.
docs.lead_paragraph: Presumably, Daniel Levy was going for a more flattering vibe. One day last month, Levy, the chairman of Tottenham Hotspur, told the students of the Cambridge University Union that he hoped a statue of Harry Kane would stand outside the club’s stadium one day, possibly its greatest-ever striker immortalized in bronze.

headline.main: Harry Kane and the End of the Line

docs.abstract: A look at women who inspired great art and literature and what might have been.
docs.snippet: A look at women who inspired great art and literature and what might have been.
docs.lead_paragraph: You’ve probably noticed, if you read this column regularly, that I think a lot about the interplay between public and private interests: the ways that personal motivations and decisions affect major public events like wars and scandals, but also the ways in which public, structural constraints affect people’s private decisions, shaping their lives and careers, and sometimes their safety.

headline.main: What I’m Reading: Wives and Muses Edition

docs.abstract: The federal National Nuclear Security Administration is setting up an advanced network that can verify an attacker’s identity.
docs.snippet: The federal National Nuclear Security Administration is setting up an advanced network that can verify an attacker’s identity.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is wiring Ukraine with sensors that can detect‌‌ bursts of radiation from a nuclear weapon or a dirty bomb and can confirm the identity of the attacker.

headline.main: U.S. Wires Ukraine With Radiation Sensors to Detect Nuclear Blasts

docs.abstract: As global warming threatens two popular species, growers in Uganda are betting on a variety that can stand up to heat, drought and pests.
docs.snippet: As global warming threatens two popular species, growers in Uganda are betting on a variety that can stand up to heat, drought and pests.
docs.lead_paragraph: First the bad news. The two coffee species that most of us drink — Arabica and robusta — are at grave risk in the era of climate change.

headline.main: African Farmers May Have a Coffee Robust Enough for the Climate Crisis
